result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin S Wearing was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Entry into Locked Coin Box, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.125(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 10 (TEN) days served; Huber privileges for TREATMENT. Court recommends against electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution payable to TIMOTHY K. for $7,366.83 or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during probation and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.
Restitution payable to ROBIN M. for $280.00 or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during probation and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.

EACH COUNT: Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges during Probation or a civil judgment to be entered.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.
Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.

Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
Medically assisted treatment if appropriate.

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence.  Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law, upon submission of motion.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol. Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Restitution Refund Packets

Defendant Justin S Wearing in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Court sentenced defendant to serve 60 (SIXTY) DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 10 (TEN) days served; Huber privileges for TREATMENT. Court recommends against electronic monitoring.  COURT STAYS SENTENCE AND PLACES DEFENDANT ON PROBATION FOR 12 (TWELVE) MONTHS.

* Restitution payable to TIMOTHY K. for $7,366.83 or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during probation and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.

AS TO COUNT 2:

Court sentenced defendant to serve 60 (SIXTY) DAYS in the House of Correction CONCURRENT to any sentence with credit for 0 (ZERO) days served; Huber privileges for TREATMENT. Court recommends against electronic monitoring.  COURT STAYS SENTENCE AND PLACES DEFENDANT ON PROBATION FOR 12 (TWELVE) MONTHS.

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges during Probation or a civil judgment to be entered.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

* Restitution payable to ROBIN M. for $280.00 or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during probation and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Medically assisted treatment if appropriate.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol. 
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence.  Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law, upon submission of motion.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.

Defendant Justin S Wearing in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.  Matter adjourned for Sentencing hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Barbara K Due in court, defendant Justin S Wearing not in court, in custody.  Jeffrey James Altenburg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. sdg
Court MODIFIES Bail to $250.00 PR Bond.
Defendant to post $400.00 Cash for release.  sdg
State requests Cash Bail.  Defense objects and requests a PR Bond.  Arguments heard.

Court reviewed report.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement report, received and filed.

Case was staffed.  Defendant is not in compliance.  Defendant missed contact with JP.  Court vacates the 8/3/2015 court date.

Defendant will continue to be monitored by Justice Point and state is willing to allow the agreement.  State will revoke if the defendant is not attending consistently.  Review hearing scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 10:00 am.

   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

NO FILE IN COURT.
Case was staffed, defendant did not appear.    Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.  Court vacates the next court date.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

AS TO  COUNTS 1 AND 2
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Criminal Complaint.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.
As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.

Defendant Justin S Wearing in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC.   Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.  Review hearing scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Court appearance scheduled in Room 310, Safety Building, on 4/28/15 @ 1:30pm
